CoreData C# API

1. Introduction
2. Distribution
3. Using CoreData
4. Compiling CoreData
5. Example Applications
6. Reference

1. Introduction

The CoreData C# API is the C# bindings for the open-source CoreData C++ library for working with data produced by Seeing Machines products.

2. Distribution

2.1 Platform/Compiler Support

The CoreData C# API is supported on the following platforms and compilers
  • Windows XP/Vista/Windows 7:
    • Visual Studio .NET 2008 Tested with .NET 3.5

2.2 Directory Structure

coredata-3.2.1.65799/   <-- User selected installation directory (where xxx is a build number)
  doc/                <-- API documentation
  cscoredata/         <-- CoreData C# API 
      bin/            <-- Precompiled examples and output directory when compiling example applications
      examples/       <-- Example applications
      lib/            <-- Precompiled csharp bindings
      src/            <-- Source code
  swigcoredata/       <-- Swig interface files

3. Using CoreData

This section describes how to use the CoreData C# API.

3.1 Assemblies

To use CoreData add references to the following assemblies, make sure you select the arrow next to the Add button and selecte Add as Link.
  • cscoredata/lib/win32_ia32sse2_vc90/SeeingMachines.CoreData.dll
  • cscoredata/lib/win32_ia32sse2_vc90/SeeingMachines.CoreDataIO.dll
  • cscoredata/lib/win32_ia32sse2_vc90/SeeingMachines.CoreDataUtils.dll

Make sure the following properties are set for these files:

  • Copy Local: True

Add the following files to the project:

  • cscoredata/lib/win32_ia32sse2_vc90/SeeingMachines.CoreData.Native3.2.dll
  • cscoredata/lib/win32_ia32sse2_vc90/SeeingMachines.CoreDataIO.Native3.2.dll
  • cscoredata/lib/win32_ia32sse2_vc90/SeeingMachines.CoreDataUtils.Native3.2.dll
  • coredata/libshared/win32_ia32sse2_vc90/sm_cd_coredata_3.2.dll
  • coredata/thirdparty/zlib1.2.3/win_ia32_vc90/libshared/zlib1.dll

Make sure the following properties are set for the files:

  • Build Action: Content
  • Copy to Output Directory: Copy if newer

Client code needs to import the appropriate modules: 

using sm.eod;       // Import CoreData types
using sm.eod.io;    // Import IO classes
using sm.eod.utils; // Import geometric and output helper functions

The CoreData C# bindings wrap the coredata shared library which is a 32-bit x86 binary.

Ensure 'Platform target' under Build settings is set to x86, otherwise a BadImageFormat exception will be raised when the assemblies attempt to load the native shared libraries.

4. Compiling CoreData

The CoreData distribution includes the full source code required to recompile the C# bindings.

We recommend you try to limit changes to the CoreData source and document these changes, so that when future CoreData releases are made you can update your code quickly and easily.

For compilation instructions, please refer to the appropriate instructions for your platform:

  • Microsoft Visual C++ .NET 2008

  • log2net
  • logconverter
